Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set the User and Group directives to a non-root user.
Rule.Verification: grep '^User apache' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf && grep '^Group apache' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The Apache user has a valid login shell.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Change the Apache user shell to /sbin/nologin.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The Apache user account is not locked.
Some Apache directories and files are not owned by root.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Change ownership of all Apache directories and files to root.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Apache directories and files do not have group ownership set to root.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set group ownership of Apache directories and files to root.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Other write access is enabled on Apache directories and files.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Remove write permissions for others from Apache directories and files.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The CoreDumpDirectory is not set to a secure directory.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure CoreDumpDirectory to a secure directory owned by root with 700 permissions.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The lock file directory is not secure.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the lock file directory is owned by root and set to 700 permissions.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The directory for the PID file is not secure.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the directory containing the PID file is owned by root and set to 700 permissions.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The ScoreBoard file is located in an insecure directory.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure the ScoreBoard file to reside in a secure directory owned by root with 700 permissions.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Apache directories and files have group write permissions.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Remove group write permissions from Apache directories and files.
Rule.Correction: find /usr/local/apache2 -type d -perm /g=w -exec chmod g-w {} \; ; find /usr/local/apache2 -type f -perm /g=w -exec chmod g-w {} \;

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The Document Root directories and files have inappropriate group write access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Remove group write permissions from Document Root directories and files.
Rule.Correction: find /var/www/html -type d -perm /g=w -exec chmod g-w {} \; ; find /var/www/html -type f -perm /g=w -exec chmod g-w {} \;

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Application writable directories are not properly restricted.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure that writable directories for applications are located outside the DocumentRoot, owned by root, and set with 750 permissions.
